intro: Paramapania rostrata, commonly known as the rostrated fern, is a rare and distinctive species belonging to the family Polypodiaceae. It is characterized by its unique morphology, featuring elongated, strap-like fronds with a narrow, pointed apex. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its reproductive structures include small, spore-bearing sorus clusters located on the undersides of the fronds. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Paramapania rostrata is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
